alert.note: Alert for Johnson; Laurens (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 30 at 4:39PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Laurens and central Johnson Counties through 515 PM EST... At 439 PM EST, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm over Lovett, or near Wrightsville, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, pea sized hail, frequent cloud to ground lightning and increased chance of a brief tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...While winds should result in minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects, this storm has also exhibited localized rotation. A brief tornado could quickly form. Locations impacted include... Wrightsville, Lovett, Meeks and Spann. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EST for central and east central Georgia.
